Name: Flask with the Nile God
Description: This is one of the household items once used in the royal palace. It is a flask showing the Nile god, represented as a human figure with a big belly and breasts. He is wearing a crown adorned with the lotus, the emblem of Upper Egypt, and the papyrus, symbol of Lower Egypt. The Nile god is holding a flask decorated with hieroglyphic text giving the name of King Tutankhamun.
